page.title: 10The New By-Pass
page.content: The Accrington Easterly by-pass provides the final stage of the high standard route,from the Calder Valley towns of north-east Lancashire to the M62 and the Manchester conurtation. It will also allow traffic between Haslingden and the north to join the M62 at Huncoat and avoid the use of the existing poorly aligned sections of the A56 and the A180 and the built up areas of Burnley and Accrington. The road is 285m above sea level at the highest point,and it runs parellel to the old pack horse route kno as the "Kings High Way".The rising bridge round about (which was completed in December 1981) at the Northern end connects with the completed link road from the M65 moterway.The Accrington easterly by-pass is 5.41m long and 573m wide and 1,009,500 cubic metres of rock and other substances were removed.
